message.content:
STEP 1:  ANALYZE AND DESCRIBE THE TARGET

There are in fact two separate “towers” (a smaller one on the left and a larger one on the right).  In total they use 16 blocks, arranged as follows:

● Left‐Hand Structure (6 blocks)
  – Shape/Layering:
    1) Two tall green pillars at left and right.  
    2) A long yellow bar across the top and another yellow bar across the bottom, forming a rectangular “frame.”  
    3) In the center of that frame, one red cube stacked on top of one blue cube.
  – Hence it is essentially five “bars/pillars” forming a rectangle, plus two small cubes in the middle.

● Right‐Hand Structure (10 blocks)
  – Bottom Layer:
    1) A green rectangular block laid horizontally as the base.  
    2) An orange cylinder rising vertically from that base.  
    3) A wide yellow bar placed horizontally above the cylinder (this is the “bottom bar” of the large square frame).
  – Middle Frame:
    4) Two tall green pillars standing vertically on either side.  
    5) A second wide yellow rectangular bar across their tops (the “top bar”).  
    6) An orange triangular wedge set into the middle opening (facing outward under that top bar).
  – Top Layers:
    7) Another green rectangular block laid horizontally atop the frame.  
    8) A small blue block sitting on that green block.  
    9) A final orange wedge forming a “roof” on top of the blue block.

STEP 2:  SELECT THE REQUIRED BLOCKS

You will need the following Dictionary indices (re‐using blocks as indicated):

• #1  (blue cube) – 2 total  
• #3  (red cube) – 1 total  
• #7  (green rectangular block, horizontal) – 2 total  
• #9  (green rectangular block, vertical/tall) – 4 total  
• #10 (yellow rectangular block, horizontal) – 4 total  
• #12 (orange cylinder, vertical) – 1 total  
• #16 (orange triangular wedge) – 2 total  

STEP 3:  DETERMINE AN ASSEMBLY ORDER

A convenient bottom‐to‐top building sequence is (block indices in braces):

{
  Step1:  Move block with index 9   (left green pillar of the small, left structure)  
  Step2:  Move block with index 9   (right green pillar of the small, left structure)  
  Step3:  Move block with index 10  (bottom yellow bar, left structure)  
  Step4:  Move block with index 1   (blue cube in center, left structure)  
  Step5:  Move block with index 3   (red cube on top of blue, left structure)  
  Step6:  Move block with index 10  (top yellow bar, left structure)  

  Step7:  Move block with index 7   (green horizontal base, right structure)  
  Step8:  Move block with index 12  (orange cylinder, standing vertically)  
  Step9:  Move block with index 10  (bottom yellow bar of the tall “window,” right structure)  
  Step10: Move block with index 9   (left green pillar, right structure)  
  Step11: Move block with index 9   (right green pillar, right structure)  
  Step12: Move block with index 16  (orange wedge inside the window)  
  Step13: Move block with index 10  (top yellow bar of the window)  
  Step14: Move block with index 7   (green block on top)  
  Step15: Move block with index 1   (blue cube atop the green block)  
  Step16: Move block with index 16  (final orange wedge on top)
}
